content.rendered:
Quest University Admission Requirements, steps to apply for admission into Quest University, English language Proficiency necessities.

Quest University Admission is ongoing for all interested who wishes to apply for admission; the admission is for all nationals:

Quest University Admission Requirements

The steps to apply are as follows:

  • Complete(click here)
  • Log in
  1. After submitting the Quest Application outline or general App you will be given an email with login details for SquareOne.
  2. Required credentials:
    1. High school or university record: An authorized duplicate of your most recent transcript or report card.
    2. Long and short essay: Quest’s program is writing-intensive, and the application essays are our window into how you communicate your ideas with the written word. Submissions are evaluated on originality, structure and flow, and language and mechanics.
    3. Bursary application form: All applicants must also complete this form or opt out of need-based support.
    4. Scholarship application form: All applicants must moreover complete this form or opt-out of merit-based scholarships.
  3. English language aptitude assessment scores
  4. Optional documents:
    1. A unique piece of work is required that carries out your individual interests and abilities, such as an artistic portfolio, video statement, or research project
    2. SAT/ACT test scores
    3. orientation letters from educators or community members
    4. Your qualified recommence or CV
    5. An extra writing piece (e.g. an assignment prepared for class)

3) Interview

  1. Once you have submitted all required supporting documents, your Admissions Counselor will review your application.

4) Admit

  1. Admissions decisions will be released via your Application category Page.

 5) Deposit

  1. If admitted, your next step is to verify your enrolment with a $500 CDN deposit ($5,000, if you are not a Canadian citizen, permanent resident, or U.S. citizen).

Intercontinental Applicants not holding citizenships are necessary to submit English Language expertise scores unless they have done the following:

  • Have finished their full-time academic studies for the last three years in which English was the language of tutoring.
  • Have spent more than four successive years in an English-speaking country.
  • Have completed or will complete the International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma by the time of starting their studies at Quest
  • Have completed the Advanced Placement (AP) exam in English with a final grade score of 4 or superior.
  • Have completed GCE Advanced (A) Level English with a final grade of C or better or GCSE/IGCSE/Ordinary (O) Level English Language, English Literature, or English as a Second Language with a final grade of B or better

English Language necessities are as follows:

  • TOEFL:
  • Students who have achieved at least 580 (paper-based), or 90 (internet-based) with a maximum 4-grade score of 21 in each of four testing sections are qualified to apply.
  • TOEFL scores must be issued to Quest directly from the Educational Testing Centre. Please make sure that Quest’s institution code (8341) is included on the TOEFL sheet.
  • Quest receives only the certified score report sent directly to the university from the testing center or by electronic submission.
  • IELTS:
  • Students who achieve an IELTS score of 6.5 or higher in each of the four areas (reading, speaking, listening, writing), are eligible to apply.
  • IELTS scores must be sent to Quest University Canada directly from the test center.
  • On the IELTS application form, you will be asked to identify institutions where you would like the results sent.
  • Duolingo:
  • Duolingo provides a convenient, fast, and affordable English language testing service for international applicants.
  • Students who receive a score of 110 or higher on the Duolingo language test are encouraged to apply.
  • Applicants should submit their results directly through the online or app-based service
